questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in the Middle East, is famous for its rock-cut architecture dating back to around the 5th century BC?
questions.context: Known as the Rose City for its color, this archaeological site was once a thriving capital of the Nabataean kingdom. It was largely unknown to the Western world until the early 19th century.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, completed in 2010, holds the title of the tallest building in the world and is located in the UAE?
questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, the design of this skyscraper was inspired by the Hymenocallis flower. It was once criticized during the global financial crisis but today is a symbol of modern Dubai.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium was the location of Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat in June 1815?
questions.context: This location marks the end of the Napoleonic Wars. The battle involved nearly 200,000 soldiers and led to Napoleon's exile to Saint Helena.

questions.question: What is the famous museum in Paris that houses the Mona Lisa and was originally built as a fortress in the 12th century?
questions.context: This museum is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, receiving nearly 10 million visitors annually.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Greece, dedicated to the city's patron goddess Athena, is known for its iconic Parthenon temple?
questions.context: The Acropolis stands on a limestone hill above the city of Athens and dates back to the 5th century BC, representing the pinnacle of classical Greek art and architecture.
